name: Techathon
description:
Techathon

What if your smartphone could talk to the microwave oven? And your car to the air conditioner? When life gets tangled in a cobweb of schedules, make sure you find your way out. Create your own technological ecosystem in the world of Internet of Things. So pull up your sleeves and get coding! It's time to break through barriers and challenges using your technical skills. Get ready for Techathon, a 24 hour IOT hackathon. Are you ready to get connected?
eventFormat:
The following electronic equipments will be provided at the venue:

  • Arduino Uno, with cable

  • ESP 8266 e01 Wi-Fi module

  • Single strand wires

  • Breadboard

The participants will also be provided with water, food, power points, stationery and Wi-Fi.


Registration Fee: ₹250 per Head

The shortlisted participants should pay the above registration fee on the day of the event.
rules:
Rules

  1. The team size should not exceed 3 members.

  2. Cross - college teams are allowed.

  3. The project must be built from scratch.

  4. Pre-programmed devices are not permitted.

  5. The participants are not allowed to leave the venue until the event is concluded.

  6. The contestants are expected to bring project specific components (sensors, actuators, jumpers etc), tools (soldering iron, wire strippers etc) and laptops.

  7. The evaluation will be based on the degree of completion, technical complexity and innovativeness of the project.

  8. Inappropriate conduct of the team will result in immediate disqualification.

  9. The components provided by the organizers should be returned undamaged upon event conclusion. Damage to provided components and properties must be reimbursed.

  10. The decision made by the judges shall be final.

name: Papyrus of Ani
description:
“The vision must be followed by the venture,it is not enough to stare up the steps - we must step up the stairs”.


Papyrus of Ani is a technical paper presentation competition - a platform to bring to light exciting technical ideas that may well be the next big thing in the field. If you have an idea worth spreading, we will provide you the apt audience to hear your thoughts. Present your idea and earn the respect of your peers and experts in the field.


Date: 5th October, Thursday

Venue: Govt. Model Engineering College, Thrikkakkara
rules:
Team Formation:

1. A team can have a maximum of 3 members

2. A participant cannot be part of more than one team .

3. It is not necessary that the participants forming a team should be from the

same college

4. There is no restriction in the number of teams from the same college .

General:

1. The work should be original and in the specified format.

2. Students pursuing their graduation and post graduation can participate

irrespective of their field of study.

3. A team cannot send in more than 2 abstracts.

4. 20% of the total marks will be allotted for format of Report and the rest is for Presentation style as well as the Question and Answer session.

5. The coordinators reserve the right of rejecting any paper following deviation of the paper from the format specified.
eventFormat:
IEEE members getting shortlisted for the event will have a discount of 20% from their excel registration fee.


This event is mainly spread over two categories namely Technical and Non Technical.Technical presentations serve engineering, scientific and high tech purposes, describing advances in technology, problem resolution, product design and project status. In Technical category, the paper/innovative ideas comes under the following field of study:

1. Electronics and Communication

2. Electronics and Biomedical

3. Electrical and Electronics

4. Computer Science

Non - Technical papers are associated with general developments in the world including any new concept or idea developed by the team. Papers can be from the areas:

  1. Wastewater Treatment and Water Supply Systems

  2. Digitization

  3. Developmentally Delayed Issues for Youth in Foster Care

  4. Tuberculosis in India: The Curse of the Increasing Inequality

  5. Urbanization - A Blessing In Disguise


Phase 1:

An abstract giving complete details of the paper in not more than 600 words is to be sent to poa@excelmec.org from 1/09/2017, on or before 20/09/2017.

Phase 2:

The teams that are shortlisted after thorough examination of the abstracts will be notified via email .

The teams must prepare a power-point presentation in MS PowerPoint in the format given here.

The teams must prepare a final paper in the IEEE format. The IEEE paper format can be downloaded here.

The final presentation will be conducted at Excel 2017. Total time allotted for presentation is 15 minutes of which, 10 minutes is for

presentation.



The following facilities are provided at Excel 2017:

1. LCD Projector

2. Microphone

3. Laptop/Computer

name: Third Eye Photography
description:
A million things can happen in a moment. From myriad emotions to familiar scents, places and it's people to memories and journeys, a moment is never enough. Photography is the art of weaving a million stories from a single moment. It’s never just about what is seen, it's always about how it is seen and experienced. For those who believe that immortality is just a click away, Excel 2017 brings you ‘The Third Eye Photography Contest’ in the memory of Vineeth Marar.


Become a storyteller, capture defining moments and share your experience through images. Ignite passions, initiate thought and inspire action through the power of the lens.
rules:
ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA: Must be an undergraduate student studying in India.

The entries must comply with the following requirements

  1. Photography, using all types of cameras (DSLR, SLR, Mobile cameras) is permitted. The type of camera must be mentioned along with each entry.

  2. All entries must be submitted in digital format via e-mail. Mails must be sent to thirdeye@excelmec.org.

  3. All entries must contain a short description of the photo, the name of the participant, name of the college/organization/school, phone number and, if possible, the exif details of the photo.

  4. All photographs must be in JPEG or JPG format.

  5. Each entrant may submit at most 3 photographs for a theme with respective descriptions. Each photo must be less than 3MB in size.

  6. Post processing of any kind is explicitly forbidden and is a criterion for disqualification.

  7. Watermarks of any kind are NOT allowed. Submitted pictures will be watermarked by the event organisers so as to prevent the misuse of the submitted picture.

  8. Submission of plagiarised photos or show of popularity using unfair means will result in the photo being disqualified for the category of People's choice.

  9. Presence of any sort of vulgarism, racism or provocation as well as copied entries, if found with valid proof, will be disqualified and deleted from the album immediately.

  10. By submitting an entry, each entrant agrees to the official rules and warrants that the entry complies with all the guidelines in the official rules.

  11. This is skill-based contest and it plays an important part in the determination of winners.

  12. Rules are subject to change at any point in time.


RELEASE

  • The winning photograph will be released on Excel 2017 Facebook page, at the end of the event.

  • Upon winning, the participant should submit College ID proof along with the original photograph.

  • Odds of winning depend upon the number of eligible entries received and the skill displayed by the entrant.

LICENSE

All entries retain the copyright to their photograph, for the duration of copyright, and may use each photograph and description for advertising, marketing and promotional purpose to any and all media now known or hereafter created.
eventFormat:
First Phase – Online Contest

Second Phase – Instant Photography


Online Contest

An online photography contest spanning 4 weeks, wherein participants will need to submit photographs related to the theme provided for that particular time period. Each week will have a different theme, which will be updated on the official Facebook page, for which the participants can submit a maximum of 3 photographs. Entries must be mailed to the e-mail address provided above. The participant can participate in all of the four sessions.

All the images received will be uploaded on Excel’s Facebook page in an album titled ‘Third Eye - Online Photography Entries’ with the caption submitted by the participant along with the ID no. provided to each participant. The photos will also be uploaded on Instagram, with the hashtags provided along with the entry.


Theme 1 – Reflections

Deadline – 11th September

Theme 2 – Innocence

Deadline – 19th September

Theme 3 – Coming Soon


Instant Photography Round:

Participants will be given a theme onsite and will be asked to take photographs based on this given theme. Participants can submit at most 3 photographs based on the particular theme. Photographs are awarded marks based on the content, originality and relevance to the theme. There will be 2 sessions without elimination and a final session for the top 5 contenders on leader-board.


Judging Criteria:

‘Judge's Choice’ winner will be selected by a panel of appointed judges. The winner will be decided purely based on thought process behind the photo, the quality and creativity exhibited by the photographer.

‘People's Choice’ winner will be decided on the basis of the popularity of the photo. ‘People's Choice’ winner will be valued as per the scoring system given below -

Facebook likes – 1 point

Instagram likes – 2 points

The winners will be announced on the Excelmec Facebook Page.

name: Game of Drones
description:
When you play the Game of Drones, you either fly or you fall. There's no middle ground.Do you daydream of flying drones and gunning for glory? If your ideas can fly as high as your drones, we have just the right venue for you.Excel 2017 presents The Game Of Drones - an event exclusively for drones. Show off your skills in robotics and earn the title of the Top Gun.

Registration fee: Rs. 800/- per team

Registration closes on: 25/09/2017

Venue: Govt. Model Engineering College, Thrikkakkara

Date: 05/10/2017
contact_details:
Components Provided By

Contacts

  • Ashwin Rajesh

    +91-9744474177

  • Sharat Ram Kumar

    +91-9495981767
rules:
• It is not mandatory for all the members of a team to be from the same educational institution.

  • A team can have a maximum of up to 4 members and a minimum of 2 members.

  • Members of a team showing disrespect to the rules or to the other competitors, shall cause immediate disqualification of his/her team.

  • The drones should not be tested/flown over a height of 10m.

  • Drones are to be built within given specifications.

  • Winners will be decided based on the final score which will be based on the performance of the drone in both round 1 and 2.

  • 240v power plugs will be provided at the venue for charging.

  • A team can use only one drone throughout the event. (only the mechanical parts can be changed in case of damage)

  • Repairs/part replacement/calibrations shall only be done at specified checkpoints.

  • Ready-made kits will be disqualified.

  • The team will be disqualified immediately if any of the drones are found to be unsafe for the audience.

  • Decision of the judges will be final and binding.

  • Rules are subject to change at any point in time. All rules will be explained at the event as well.
eventFormat:
The event is not a simultaneous race, and will be a time based obstacle race.


Round 1(Qualifiers):

The Teams will have to face a qualifier round if the number of teams participating exceed 15. It will be a short round with a single obstacle. The first 15 teams(based on the time taken to complete the course) will qualify to the next round.


Round 2:

Round 2 will consist of a circular course with simple obstacles. This round will test the speed and agility of the drone. This round will be timed.


Round 3:

Round two will consist of an obstacle course with challenges of increasing difficulty.

Each obstacle will have points based on their difficulty.


The final result will be based on the total points earned in round 2 and 3.


The arena will be revealed only before the commencement of the event.


Robot Specifications:

  • Drone dimensions should not exceed 50x50x20 cm and should not be less than 15x15x20.

  • NO restriction in rating of motors used or frame material.

  • Drone should be capable of a minimum flight time of 5 minutes.

  • FPV drones are allowed.

name: Robowar
description:
Are you game for a round of sheer grit and guts? Do you have what it takes to battle it out for the ultimate glory? Prepare yourself for a no-holds-barred, nerve wrecking metal against metal carnage. So grab your bots and get ready to rumble! Only the worthy shall be left standing when the dust settles.

Venue: Govt. Model Engineering College, Thrikkakkara

Date: 06/10/2017
contact_details:
Contacts

  • Anwar Babu

    +91-7293177801

  • Aravind R Gopal

    +91-9349601432

Registered teams will get component discount coupons from:
rules:
1. Each team can have up to four members.
  2. Every participant must have their college ID card/Excel participation ID.
  3. Registrations close at 10.00 am of the day of event.
  4. It is not mandatory for all the members of a team to be from the same institution.
  5. The Robot must be manually controlled through wired/wireless interface.
  6. Maximum permitted dimensions of the robot are 45 cm X 45 cm X 45 cm and its weight must not exceed 25 kg. 10% tolerance in weight and dimensions are allowed.
  7. Each robot must have its own power supply not exceeding 24V. However a power point(230V AC) will be provided for recharging batteries or to power your supply.
  8. Bots can have any forms of weapons (other than fire, sharp objects and projectiles), if any bot is found unsafe for the audience, it’ll be not allowed to participate in the event.
  9. All teams will have to have their bots inspected by the coordinators both before and after each stage.
  10. Teams are permitted to make minor changes to the body of their robot after every stage if they wish; but modifying the entire body of the robot will not be permitted.
  11. Arena will be disclosed only at the time of the event.
  12. Only two members from each team are allowed to operate the bot during each stage.
  13. Both members are allowed to control the bot staying behind the board. So the wire must be of sufficient length in order to cover the entire arena.
  14. Any team/team member found disrespecting the rules/other competitors, will be disqualified.
  15. Bonus points will be announced one hour prior to the event.
  16. Coordinators can change the event format at any time during the event.
  17. The decision of the judges will be final and binding.
  18. Cross-college teams are allowed.
  19. Malpractices and sabotaging other teams' machines will lead to immediate disqualification.
  20. Organizers reserve the right to make decisions in case of conflicts and other issues.
eventFormat:
Round 1:

Preliminary round

Robots will be divided into two groups. Each robot will have to face every member of its own group and the top four will move to the semi-finals.

Points are awarded based on the following fields - speed, skill, controlling ability and strength.

Match Duration - 5 minutes.

Point Distribution:

  • Distribution of bonus points will only be announced one hour prior to the event.

  • Knocking the opponent off the arena-20 point

  • Immobilizing it for 10 seconds - 10 point


Round 2:

The Semi-finals

  • The arena will have undergone some changes.

  • One-on-One Knockout.

  • There will be two semi-finals.

  • The winners of the two semi-finals will qualify to the Grand Finale.

  • Time limit of this round will be 10 minutes.

Point Distribution:

Knockout – 20 point.

Immobilising the opponent for 15 seconds – 10 point.


Round 3: Final

The Grand finale

One-on-one knockout round.

10 minute battle.

The bot with the maximum points wins.

Point Distribution:

Knockout – 20 point.

Immobilizing the opponent for 10 seconds – 10 point.


Robot Specifications:

Maximum permitted dimensions of the robot are 45 cm X 45cm X 45 cm and its weight must not exceed 25 kg. 10% tolerance in weight and dimensions are allowed.

Each robot must have its own power supply not exceeding 24V.

name: Robosoccer
description: It ain’t man-to-man. It'll be bot-to-bot. The robots go rolling the ball this time. Build your bot, and get them on their way to the golden boot! Lace up and get your bots kicking! Take control and master the ultimate soccer tournament.
contact_details:
Contacts

    +91-9567360956

  • Jojo George

    +91-9562060780

Registered teams will get component discount coupons from:
rules:
1. One team can have a maximum of 4 members and all members may not be same college.
  2. Every participant must have their college ID card/ Excel participation ID.
  3. Each team can only use one bot for the match.
  4. The team which manages to score the maximum number of goals win. In case of draw. it will be sudden death.
  5. The controller should stay behind his/her goal post.
  6. The bots will be placed at opposite corners of the stage before start of each session.
  7. The match shall be paused if bots are unable to move or if anything goes wrong. Under the direction of the judges. The reset position will be determined by the same.
  8. All teams will have to have their bots inspected by the coordinators before the commencement of the match.
  9. Coordinators can change the event format at any time during the event.
  10. Decision of the judge shall be final.


BONUS

Wireless bot will be given an advantage of 1 extra goal in case of a tie.
eventFormat:
Round 1:

PRELIMINARY ROUND

  1. Teams will be divided into two groups.
  2. Each team will have to face one other teams of its own group based on random selection and the top two will be move to semi-finals.
  3. The positions will be determined by the points scored by each team.
  4. There won’t be any tie breaker during prelims.


POINT DISTRIBUTION: 1 goal – 1 point.

MATCH DURATION: 6 minutes. Break of 30 seconds after 3 mins match.


Round 2:

THE SEMI-FINALS

  1. The team with maximum number of goals in the match wins.
  2. In case of tie, it will be sudden death.
  3. The winners of semi-finals will qualify to Grand Finale.


MATCH DURATION: 8 minutes. Break of 1 minute after 4 minutes of match.


Loser’s final:

  1. The team with maximum number of goals in match wins.
  2. In case of tie. It will be sudden death.
  3. The winner gets the 3rd prize.

MATCH DURATION: 8 minutes. Break of 1 minute after 5 minute of match.


Round 4:

THE GRAND FINALE

  1. The team with maximum number of goals in match wins.
  2. In case of tie. It will be a sudden death.
  3. The winner gets 1st price. Loser 2nd

MATCH DURATION: 10 minutes. Break of 1 minute after 5 minute match.


NOTE: POINTS ARE NOT CARRIED TO NEXT LEVEL. Higher points at the end of round do not guarantee any leverage in the next rounds.


Robot Specifications:

  1. The dimension of the bot should not exceed 30cm length, 20cm height and 30cm height.
  2. The maximum weight of the bot should not exceed 5kgs.
  3. The bot must be manually controlled through wired/wireless interface.
  4. The length of wire (if wired) should be enough for the bot to travel throughout the stage. The wire should not be in the way of ball or opponent.
  5. Actuators that may help in the motion of the bot are allowed.
  6. Users of readymade bots are not allowed.
  7. Each of bot must have its own power supply not exceeding 12V.
  8. Trap for ball should not be in any other shape then rectangle with front side open. The breadth should be less than 5cm. This by whole should fit under the dimensional constrains.
